name: unshared
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not owned, divided, felt, or experienced by more than one person: We had very few unshared possessions; it was rare to have anything of my own. They are middle-age people with a lot of unshared history.
not published or made known to other people: Shared links are far more valuable to advertisers than unshared ones.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was the first person to win two unshared Nobel Prizes.They would have preferred unshared, independent accommodation.It was another unshared experience, another difference between them.His studies of twins showed that environment, whether shared or unshared, had a much greater influence than genes.
